152.content:
“Thanks a lot for joining us today guys, remember to tune back in tomorrow for more dirty deets on our friends Mark and Aubrey on an all new Second Date Update!”

“Sounds saucy, I can’t wait!”

“And make sure you look for us on the IRadio app so you can tune in for all your hits at any time. In fact, tune in tomorrow morning from your phone! Because after all, what’s better than waking up with a KISS from two sexy radio DJs?”

With that, the live feed was cut. The two women went limp in their chairs, finally able to relax after a long day’s work of plugging ads and taking calls in their own little hotbox. Cass flung herself forward, leaning on her panel where she’d taken all her notes, while Marni slumped back into her seat. It was an ungodly hot Summer day, and the AC unit in the building had given out earlier in the week. The crew had done what they could with electric fans and lots of bottled waters, but it just simply wasn’t cutting it. What’s worse, the fans kept blowing into the feed, so they had to move them whenever they were on the air—which meant lots of commercial breaks.

“Thank gawd.” Marni whined as she hopped out of her chair, her brown hair frizzy and curly from the heat, “I thought today would never end.”

“You’re telling me.” Cass agreed flatly as she poured herself onto the floor, “At least they’ve finally got a crew up there.”

Cass Morgan and Marni Smith had been doing this for a while—for too long, they both often thought. The Cass and Marni Morning Show had traveled to three different states in the past nine years, never really finding its niche while Cass and Marni spent their twenties trying to figure out how to appeal to their frequently changing audience. They were running on their third year now and they had just gotten renewed for their fourth year at their latest studio. Which would have been great if they weren’t so willing to cut corners…

“Hey, you want another water before lunch?” Marni bent over and reached into the ice bucket that an intern had provided, rattling the ice around as she searched for a particularly cold one

“Yeah, sure.” Cass held out her hand, “Hydrate me.”

Despite their closeness, Cass and Marni couldn’t have been any more different—appearance-wise or in personality. Marni was a short woman whose feet didn’t even touch the ground when she sat in her booth, with slight curves and a round face that gave her a very young appearance to better fit with her sillier personality. They were the same age of course, but Marni was the only one who got carded at the club. Cass was a statuesque, tallish woman with a large bust and long brown locks that came to tickle the back of her shoulders. Her lean figure was an accomplishment attributed to long hours of yoga and self-control, very much contrasting the soft svelteness of her lazier coworker. They had few interests in common, aside from their shared interest in broadcast, but managed to make themselves into quite the working pair.

The two women left their mics, waters in tow, and stepped out into the less blistering section of the recording studio.

“Marty, tell me those guys are gonna be done by tomorrow.” Marni took a big gulp from her bottle as she approached a slight man with a goatee, “One more day like this and you’re gonna have to work “extra crispy” into our show’s title.”

“Already on it. Great show today, you guys.” Marty said confidently as he gave a congratulatory handshake to both women, “I just wanted to let you know that since you guys have signed on, we’ve been picking up sponsors like crazy.”

Ugh. Sponsors. As in those guys that they had to stay after for later today to make those stupid pre-recorded commercials that everyone hated.

“Great.” Cass rolled her eyes, “What have you got us peddling now?”

“We are peddling—“ Marty said with a playful emphasis on Cass’ negative tone, “—for some company called Gordge Enterprises.”

“What do they do?” Marni asked, taking another sip, “Are they, like, some kind of tech company or something?”

“Er… they do lots of things.” Marty said unsuredly, “But who cares right—they’re fans! They like your show so much they wanna give us money—that’s what this whole biz is about, right?”

“I guess.” Cass rolled her eyes

“Look, they’re so happy to have you guys, they sent you two a little something.” Marty took both women by their sweaty shoulders, “It’s in the break room fridge. Go in, cool down, and check it out.”

Cass and Marni let out matching sighs as they peeled themselves away from their supervisor. Today hadn’t exactly been the easiest days, and while it was nice to know that they had such dedicated fans, it didn’t exactly make them feel any more certain about what they were doing. Things had become just so… blah. And not just in their latest town, but in general. It was a lot harder being a radio host than either one of them really thought it would be way back when they started this…

As soon as they reached the break room, Cass flung herself down on the couch while Marni made a bee-line for the fridge. While the taller of the two situated herself as comfortably as she could in the scorching heat, Marni opened the door (enjoying the momentary break from the heat) and pulled out a giant wicker basket wrapped in cellophane.

“To Cass and Marni, From Gordge Enterprises. Please enjoy the first—but certainly not the last—courtesy gift that comes with Gordge Enterprises’ sponsorship.” Marni read aloud from the card attached before flipping it over, “And back here it says We really like your show—Alice G., Melissa H., and Courtney S..”

“Jesus Christ that’s huge!” Cass said with surprise as Marni set it down on the table, “They just gave this to us?”

“Apparently.” Marni said with similar surprise.

The two women peeled apart the wrapping on the basket and took a good look inside; taking note of all the snacks and goodies that they had been sent. Candy, snack cakes, coupons to restaurants; there was enough food in there to last a week!

“That is a lot of food.” Marni said, her hands on her hips as they looked over the generous spread, “These Gordge people are crazy generous.”

“Seriously.” Cass let out a little whistle, “Never gotten benefits like this before.”

***


And so they took advantage of their little perk. They skipped their usual outing to their usual venue, and treated themselves to the plentiful goodies inside the Gordge Benefits basket. Neither Cass nor Marni could really say no to such a generous spread, and from such dedicated fans of the show. They did their recordings, plugged their ads, and made sure to keep Gordge Enterprises happy for the forseeable future.

However, the benefits didn't stop there. Baskets arrived once a week, each one as full as the first. Gordge Enterprises donated a new AC unit to the studio in exchange for more adspace for their company and other affiliated clients. Money was pouring in, their bosses couldn't have been happier.

But between all the welcome baskets, complementary discount dinners at partnered restaurants, and freely accepting the suggestions from their friends in the Gordge Enterprises break room, it was beginning to seriously affect...
152.title: the Cass and Marni Morning Show

choices: All this free food starts to get to Cass. After a few weeks, she's put on weight
the execs organize a studio lunch with some of the employees from Gordge
Free Choice
1521.content:
Between all the welcome baskets, complementary discount dinners at partnered restaurants, and freely accepting the suggestions from their friends in the Gordge Enterprises break room, it was beginning to seriously interfere with Cass’ exercise regimen. It started out rather small, some minor inconveniences that weren’t quite enough to cause concern but enough to throw off her carefully crafted routine.

Gordge was a company that dipped its fingers in a lot of smaller businesses around town, both women to wake up early or stay a little later to pre-record commercials for various businesses around town. It was something that they did normally, yes, but Gordge’s sponsorship required doing a whole slew of them. So, for fear of sounding burnt out on the recordings, Marty decided that it would be best if the girls did them one or two at a time for about a week. Rather than wake up even earlier (four ‘o’ clock in the morning was enough, thank you very much!) Cass just skipped her morning workout routine. She rolled out of bed, did her makeup, got dressed, and went out the door without doing her stretches or her cardio.

With only her morning coffee to wake her up, Cass was usually a little groggy by the time she made it to the studio. She had something of a tradition where she would grab one of the breakfast bars from their dressing room before going on the air, but Marty needed the new commercials recorded ASAP. Luckily for her appetite, not so much for her conscience, Gordge had started delivering them donuts every morning, which they kept right outside the studio for convenience’s sake. Marty practically ushered her into the recording room, pressed for time.

“Can’t a girl get some breakfast first?” Cass bit back groggily at his pace

“Here just…” Marty plucked a crème-filled pastry randomly from the box, “J-Just eat this. And be quick about it—once Marni gets here, we’re going on the air!”

Their morning show went mostly unchanged, thankfully. There were no censorships in place, and there was no interference with the programs already scheduled. They still did Second Date Update, Ask Cass, To Catch a Cheater, and et cetera, but there was a slight push from their new sponsors to include products from affiliated companies in their morning discussions. They were given plenty of free samples across a wide variety of companies to “test out” for the show, and the studio execs actually pushed to have a new program created called KISS it or Cram it—a solid ten minutes taken out of every day where one of the girls would talk about a certain product that they were gifted from one company, talk about how awesome it was, and basically mention how easy it made their lives.

“So today’s KISS It or Cram it is dedicated to the PediPad.” Cass said into the microphone one morning, powdered sugar dusting the corner of her lips, “It’s made by the good people at You—the company that makes and designs products based for… well, you—and… it’s just… wow. Just so wow.”

“Someone’s feeling very articulate today.” Marni teased

“No, for real, it’s fantastic. It’s this high-end foot massager that reads the stress and strain on your feet—like say, after a long day at work, you come home from work or from a workout—and it gives you a personalized, deep-tissue massage every single time you use it. It tailors what it does to fit how sore your feet are!” Cass actually pulled up a picture on her phone and showed it to Marni, “Ladies, you know me, I’m all about fitness. But I just got this thing, and I sit down and I put my feet in it, and all I want to do is {i]relax…”

But the most intrusive part of Gordge’s sponsorship had to be their insistence that their clients got the most detailed review possible. It was understandable, of course, that they wanted their companies to be represented honestly and professionally reviewed. So all the new gadgets and frivolities that came with sponsoring companies like You or Gadgetech were to be expected. Even if it meant that Cass had to take time out of her workout routine to test things like the PediPad or the shoe organizer from Mauve and John’s, she didn’t necessarily mind so much. It was part of the job, right?

But more often than not, Cass and Marni found themselves dining out. Gordge apparently sponsored a lot of local restaurants (chains or otherwise) and expected the same treatment that they gave to the other companies. It was in their contract, actually. Marty was insistent on ordering from Gordge-affiliated eateries for lunch in the studio, taking extra steps to keep the money flowing into their pockets. Thanks to the discounts provided by Gordge’s sponsorship, Cass and Marni actually found themselves eating out more, even when they weren’t on the clock. This wasn’t so much of a problem for fun-loving, laissez-faire Marni. But when it came to salad-munching, ab-crunching Cass, who lived on nearly half the calories that Marni did, all this food was beginning to become a bit overwhelming!

“Hey Cass, wanna hit up House of Wings?” Marni asked her one day, not long into their sponsorship, “It’s about dinner time, right?”

“Ugh. No way.” Cass burbled, cradling a swollen stomach, “I’m still full from lunch.”

“Oh come on, don’t be such a baby.” Marni psshaw’d with a playful punch in Cass’ well-toned arm muscle, “You had like, one sandwich.”

“A footlong! With sausage and ham and turkey and enough empty calories to send me to the hospital.” Cass rolled her eyes as she walked her teeny-weeny cohost into the parking lot, “Seriously, all this food is killing me. I feel like I’m going to pop.”

“Well don’t do it in my car.” Marni hit the unlock button on her key fob, “C’mon, you still owe me for bailing when you got that stupid foot massager.”

“Bluh. I feel like I need to hit the gym.” Cass gave a self-conscious rub across her bloated belly, “I’ve been eating a lot lately.”

“Hey, House of Wings is on the way!” Marni said sarcastically, “We can just… y’know, pull into the Fit Life parking lot, park, and then leave. That’s technically going to the gym, right? I mean, you went there, am I right?”

“Ugh… I just hope Gordge sponsors an AbLounge next or something.” Cass puffed as she poured herself into the passenger seat, “I don’t think I can take much more of this…”
1521.title: Cass Gordges Herself

choices: Cass goes to eat with Alice and her friends. What's the harm, right?
Cass is too self-conscious to deal with fans right now.
Cass and Alice get to talking, and hit it off really well, becoming friends
15212.content:
After all the dust had settled onto their new relationship with Gordge Enterprises, Cass and Marni found themselves growing more and more comfortable with all the changes that partnering with the up-and-coming company had made. Adjustments were made on both ends, one party accommodating the other on various issues, until a mutual trust was built between them. Gordge got their advertising, the Studio got its money, and Cass and Marni were free to reap the benefits that their new sponsorship provided them.

However, despite Gordge’s willingness to indulge their two local celebrities, they were finding that some things were non-negotiable…

***


“Ugh. An office party though, seriously?” Marni curled her nose as she looked out onto the rolling hillside of the local park, “Seriously—I thought these went the way of Dinosaurs and VCRs.”

“Hey, be nice.” Marty snapped at the smaller woman, who stuck out her tongue in response, “These Gordge folks are paying us a lot of money; the least you could do is sit down for a few hours, keep your trap shut, and eat some free food.”

“I’d much rather breathe the stale, recycled air of our hotbox.” Marni snarked as she crossed her arms defiantly at Marty, who made his way out into the park to mingle, “Seriously Cass, what are we, Gordge employees now?”

“I don’t know, Marn… might do us some good.” Cass said with a weak smile, her arms wrapped around her torso defensively, “You know, socialize, fresh air… get some exercise, maybe?”

Marni rolled her eyes again and stomped off in a huff, leaving Cass all by her lonesome. Once her itsy-bitsy co-host was out of sight, Cass relaxed the grip of her arms around her waist. She breathed a sigh of relief, content to finally let her breath out. She’d been holding it in since the car ride over, doing her best to flatten her tummy, but she just couldn’t take it any longer…

Hff.

Beneath the protective shielding of her arms, her waist thickened slightly as she let go of the breath she’d been holding in her chest. It was hardly noticeable, especially not with the precautions she’d taken in anticipation of going out and about today, but the extra ten pounds or so may as well have been ten thousand to Cass Morgan as she struggled to deal with her extra dough.

She’d been forced to break out a baggy pink flannel shirt for these people, and her jeans were tight as all get-out. She felt practically naked in everything else—what with that oh-so-slight belly bulge that almost nobody but her could have detected—but she hardly felt confident at all. Cass had never been more than five pounds overweight in her entire life, let alone ten. The baggy clothes did little to boost her esteem; in fact it did just the opposite, Cass felt like a whale! She should have been burning this free time shedding some pounds at the gym, not fulfilling yet another contractual obligation with these Gordge people. Every second smelling hotdogs and burgers and all that greasy, salty prepackaged food in the air was another second spent ballooning up rather than slimming down.

Cass was so self conscious in fact, so put off by the inactivity of it all, that the normally confident and sterling broadcaster found herself doing her best to shrink into the background of this event. She didn’t know anyone, nobody knew what she looked like (even if they were huge fans of the show, that was one of the perks of being a radio star!), so that gave nobody any reason to just come up and—

“O-Oh my god… a-are you…?”

Shit.

“Y-You’re Cass Morgan!” came the cries of one star-struck fan, far off to her right, “F-From the show, right? Cass and Marni?!”

“I-I, uh… I don’t…“ Cass shrank modestly before turning to face her approaching fan, whereupon she found herself at something at a loss for words, “…woah.”

Rapidly approaching from the port side was a real whale of a woman, a real chair-squasher if there ever were one. She was about as big around the belly as a beach ball, tucked into some ill-fitting casual clothes that were hardly park-going fare. She looked to have outgrown them just recently—the sly sliver of her belly threatened to pop right out of the waistband of her khakis. She had a really pretty face though, beneath all the chins, and gorgeous blonde hair that fell down to her shoulders. On her right tit, there was a nametag that said “Hello, my name is… Alice”

“Uh, yeah!” ‘Alice’ said excitedly, “Woah is right! I can’t believe you guys actually came!”

“Well, uh…” Cass did her best not to stare as Alice’s chest heaved and ho’d with every belabored breath that the quaking office fatty took, “Yeah, y’know, happy to be here.”

“Happy to have you! Y’know, it was my idea to have Gordge sponsor you guys!” Alice said proudly, taking Cass’ hand and shaking it lightly, “I-I’m just… wow. It’s so weird. My friends and I listen to you guys every day—we love your show!”

“Oh yeah?” Cass eased up slightly, coming out of her shoulders somewhat, “Well that’s really nice of you guys. Me and Marn are always happy to meet a fan.”

“Marn.” Alice snorted giddily, “Hey, me and the girls were actually just about to sit down and have something to eat, would you… I don’t know, maybe want to come say hello?”

Cass initially recoiled at the thought. The last thing she really wanted to do right now was eat, given that all she had been doing lately was scarfing down junk that Gordge sponsored. She’d had so much free food lately that the thought of any more honestly made her a little sick. But what else was she going to do; stand there all day in the sun and bake? And Alice seemed nice enough, even if she was a little overzealous…
15212.title: Cass and the Corporate Lunch

choices: Cass' friendship with Alice is making her really lazy, and really fat!
Cass manages to talk Alice into going to the gym with her. Exercise, anyone?
the Studio execs pick up more sponsorhip from more restaurants. Oh no!
152123.content:
It wasn’t exactly automatic, but Cass and Alice had really hit it off by the end of the day. They proved to have quite a bit in common, despite their wildly different personalities and interests, and sort of complemented each other in an odd way. Cass liked to talk, Alice liked to listen—and with plenty of interesting interviews beneath her belt, that meant Cass had a lot of stories to tell. Even as Cass was slowly integrated into the pool of Alice’s coworkers at Gordge, as she met Melissa and Courtney and Victoria and all the other office women, the two women seemed to get along rather nicely. So nicely, in fact, that they continued to kindle their friendship even after the office outing.

Over the next few weeks, the two women continued to keep in touch. There was some texting, a couple of phone calls, but their friendship mostly manifested in a few friendly afternoon lunches together. Being the host of a morning show Cass and Marni were off the clock by around noon, which crept into the latter half of Alice’s two-hour break. A few times, at least once a week, Cass and Alice would meet up at some restaurant around town—often with Melissa and, once these meals became more commonplace, Courtney—and eat lunch together.

Despite her considerable size, Alice was more than willing—almost eager—to order greens and low-calorie options (albeit in rather large portions!) wherever the two of them went; something that Cass was grateful for. With less time than she would have liked to devote to keeping her body toned and lean, and her own lacking self-control as of late, Cass readily braced herself against Alice’s promising amounts of self-restraint.

“I’m trying to lose some weight.” Alice had said with a distasteful curl of her nostril one day at lunch, “Y’know, try and get my Varsity Squad body back.”

And Cass couldn’t have agreed more. Now unaccustomed to her workout routine, the slacking siren was finding it hard to get herself back into the game. It had been at least three weeks since she’d been to the gym, and even longer since she’d actually broken a sweat. Which is, honestly, why she found herself going out with Alice more and more. All Marni wanted to do was go out and club. All those empty calories—that expensive beer and bar food—weren’t good for Cass’ waistline.

However, once Melissa and Courtney became more frequent fixtures in their party of two, temptation once again reared its ugly head.

“Come on Alice, don’t tell me you’re just going to get a salad.” Melissa, another woman whose overall size was comparable to Alice’s, nudged her flabby friend in the flank, “Who comes to a buffet and orders the salad bar?”

“I don’t know…” Alice would say, looking to Cass, “You’re right, I guess… i-it is kind of dumb. Cass, do you want to maybe try out the buffet?”

And of course she would agree—she’d been good for a long time, right? Only taking samples from the Gordge baskets, doing her best not to abuse her discounted meals at the various restaurants around town, picking low-calorie options, the usual. She deserved a reward here and there!

But as Alice’s friends, who were hardly bound to Alice’s lofty ideas of diet and moderation, became more familiar with Cass, they also became more persuasive. Soon Melissa didn’t have to nudge the two dieters into picking the buffet option, and it became something that they indulged in “only when Melissa was around.” But after that, it became Alice breaking down and taking the low road, convincing the poor dieting DJ that it was okay to have a little treat every once in a while. And by the end of it, it just became habit. Pretty soon, Cass was eating at buffets almost every day for lunch!

“Hey Cass, I was gonna try out that singles bar downtown later… wanna head out?” Marni leaned over her stand, arms folded and propping up her head as her feet swung in her chair, “It’s been a while since we just… hung out, y’know?”

“Hm?” Cass smacked her lips, a plastic-wrapped Porky’s Pastries muffin with a big bite taken out of it placed firmly in one hand, “What, like… go clubbing? C’mon Marn, you know if I go out with you tonight, we’ll stay out late. I kinda want to sleep before tomorrow’s show.”

“And? Come on, let’s go out.” Marni pouted, sticking her lower lip out as far as it would go, “I feel like I never see you anymore.”

“Mmpmh…” Cass took another big bite of muffin and swallowed. She poured herself onto her feet, dusting the muffin debris off of her accumulated paunch and out of her shelf-like cleavage, “I know, I swear we’ll hang out soon. But I already told Alice we’d meet up at that new Chinese place for lunch today. Maybe you want to come with?”

“I’ll pass.” Marni puffed, irritated, “Maybe this weekend?”

“This weekend, definitely.” Cass managed through her muffin mouth, “See you then.”

Marni watched as Cass made her way out the door, full rear and thick legs swaying behind her as her biggened belly threatened to pop the buttons on her tightening blouse. She rolled her eyes and whipped out her phone, the responsibility of being her adult supervision and straight man falling on one of her other friends yet again…
152123.title: Cass and the Corpulence of Codependency

choices: With Alice and her friends at Gordge enabling her,Cass starts to get pretty big!
Marni gets tired of not having her friend around. The two have a fight!
Free Choice
1521231.content:
“Cass, I don’t know…” came Alice’ meek voice from the changing room, “I feel like I look ridiculous…”

“What? No way!” Cass said with her hands on her widening hips, “Come on out sweetie, I’m sure you look fine.”

The door opened on Fit Life’s sole handicap changing room, slowly revealing a meek mountain of a woman standing inside. Alice had apparently followed Cass’ advice and forgone all the expensive exercise gear that she’d seen the day before when they’d planned this little outing. She was tarped in a simple t-shirt, stretched tight around her double-wide figure, and her legs were crammed into pink spandex. Her hair was pulled back into a tight little bun, giving Cass a clear view of her round cheeks and her swaddling double chin. Alice had to turn sideways to get out of the booth.

“See, I told you they made yoga pants in your size.” Cass reassured her enormous friend

“They don’t.” Alice squeaked, “These are maternity sweats…”

“I didn’t know you had a baby?” Cass raised one eyebrow in shock

“I don’t…”

They had been talking about going to the gym for weeks now. Between all the lunches and the after-work get-togethers with all the girls from Gordge, not to mention having to turn in early almost every night so she could get enough sleep before the Morning Show, there wasn’t much time to work it in. They’d finally made the time after more than a month of empty promises, with both women going out and buying new workout gear for the occasion.

In truth, Cass had suggested it as a way of attempting to hide her substantial weight gain. She had grown quite soft in the months since renewing her contract with the studio. She had made excuse after excuse, slowly falling off the fitness wagon, ever since the beginning of the year. She’d let herself go really badly, but she knew she could get her body back with a little help and support. Since Marni didn’t seem to be particularly interested, that meant that she had to bank on Alice—who, in her defense, had mentioned trying to get her own figure back quite a few times since she’d known her.

Cass’ flabby stomach oozed over the waistband of her spandex bottoms, which were stretched to transparency around her broad cheeks and thick thighs. She’d tucked her tummy into the pants, making them bulge out noticeably, even beneath her t-shirt. Any trace of muscle that she once had was now buried under layers of soft fat, brought on by months of inactivity and indulgence. Though she would admit to herself, and only to herself, that standing next to Alice made her feel substantially better about her body. At least, Cass consoled herself quietly, she'd never be as big as Alice was.

The two of them went to the man floor of the gym; a sea of treadmills, elliptical machines, exercise bikes, and more laid spread out before them. It had actually been so long that Cass was genuinely at a loss as to where to start. Not at the elliptical, that seemed like too much. But the exercise biked seemed too easy. She wanted to work up a sweat, but she didn’t want to tire herself out so much that she couldn’t continue. There were plenty of other rooms in Fit Life—with lots of classes being offered. She was a premium member; maybe one of those rooms had something a little better suited for her? But could she really face her yoga instructor?

“So… do you want to… I don’t know, hop on a treadmill?” Alice suggested finally, ripping the doughy DJ from her predicament, “Seems like a good place, I guess.”

“Y-Yeah!” Cass said in a feigned confidence, “Totally. Wherever you want to start!”

The two women claimed a set of treadmills, and Cass set their respective paces. She had put Alice on a relatively low setting, so as not to discourage her, but enough to challenge her. Meanwhile, Cass had made the grave mistake of putting herself at her old speed, to which she found very quickly that she was no longer capable of matching.

Cass felt like she was running a marathon. Her leg muscles, atrophied after months of misuse, were awoken suddenly and sharply. Her stamina had nosedived, barely able to maintain a steady pace after just a minute on the tread, due to a combination of her newfound weight and her lazy lifestyle. She was sweating for the first time in months—a real sweat, one that left her sticky and hot—as she struggled to maintain a pace, rather than a steady one. Finally she just had to give up. She got off the treadmill, bent over her knees, sputtering and spewing like a faulty engine.

“I’m… I’m doing it!” Alice puffed confidently, enjoying her leisurely pace on her own treadmill, “Cass, do you think you could maybe turn up my speed a little?”

“Er… not now.” Cass said abashedly, “Let’s, uh… let’s try the exercise bikes.”

Even faced with the reality that she wasn’t in quite the same shape that she was used to be, Cass still found herself bested by every machine that the gym had to offer. She was beat pretty badly by the exercise bike, finding her legs in such supple shape that they were hardly equipped to handle the pressures of Fit Cass’ workout. The elliptical made her thighs and arms hurt, even after setting it to no resistance. And with Alice beside her every step of the way, huffing and puffing like she was about to pass out at every second, Cass just finally had to break down and stop.

“Okay… okay… good effort.” Cass puffed, her spirits crushed, “Let’s… let’s just call it a day… okay?

“But… I was having… fun!” Alice was still winded, despite the fact that they had been sitting for some time now, “You… you said you… you wanted to…”

“I know what I said.” Cass bit back, “But I’m not… I just… I can’t…”

Alice watched as her friend began to tear up. Cass chewed on her bottom lip, struggling to hold back her tears as she was faced with the reality that she had really let herself go. Alice had seen that frustration, that desperation, in her own face more than a few times as she slowly ballooned over the years.

“Hey Cass?” Alice said softly to her teary-eyed friend, “You’re a premium member, right?”

“Yeah, don’t remind me.” Cass sniffled, “The studio sponsors this gym… Why?”

***


The two women lay in the restricted spa section of Fit Life, available only to Premium Members. It was a luxurious space, with few and far patrons between the rooms that it encompassed. Cass couldn’t even hear the grunts and clamor of the gym fare in the other room as she lay sprawled out in her wooden recliner, a green facial mask on with two pickles over her eyes. Her freshly wetted hair was wrapped up in a towel, and her still damp body was covered by a big fluffy robe. The worries of earlier that day had melted beneath massages and manicures, all at a low-low cost.

“This was a good idea.” The chubbing hostess said with a smile on her face as she popped a complementary chocolate into her mouth, “I needed this. Thank you, Alice.”

“No problem.” Alice said contentedly from her position on the massage table as four masseurs kneaded and squeezed her abundant form, “Thank you for letting me be your plus one.”
1521231.title: Cass and the Crime of Idleness

choices: Cass comes to work for Gordge—oh, how the mighty have fallen
Cass refuses—not that she has any better alternatives...
15212312.content:
Cass had been in the middle of lunch. A long lunch, admittedly. She'd been plopped down in the studio break room since about one in the afternoon, right after their show went off the air, taking full advantage of her sponsorship perks. Yesterday, on a restaurant crawl with Alice and the girls, she'd stopped at no less than three restaurants on a mission to pick up lunch for the next day. And it wasn't until well into the night, their bellies having gone from soft and flabby to turgid and drum-tight, that she made good on that statement. Cass had taken two full courses into the studio today; an especially large hamburger with bacon and egg trimmings, fries on the side as well as an equally heavy chicken dish that was covered in cheese, tomato, and various spices. Ostensibly, the former was for breakfast, but she'd forgotten all about that dish when she spied the donuts on the counter. Now she had to eat them both—not that she'd complained.

It was around halfway through her burger when Marni and the studio executives came into the break room.

Cass and Marni had been friends long before they were co-stars of the KISS radio show. Ever since they were two strangers announcing local events at their community college, what at first seemed to be insurmountable differences became a fierce and fast friendship between the two siren-voiced sweethearts. What seemed like forever ago, the two of them had only signed on to do their morning show if it meant that they could do it together—which meant that the ensuing conversation between the two former friends was incredibly uncomfortable for at least one party present.

"I'm what?"

***


Hours later, after the Gordge Offices had gotten out for the day, Alice politely declined the various invitations to go to this bar or that restaurant. After the abrupt, worrying message that Cass had sent her about being fired, all she could think about was getting to her friend and favorite (former) radio hostess's apartment as soon as she could. Unfortunately, that meant waiting a full three hours after it had been delivered.

In that time, Cass had already fallen well into her downward spiral. The pants that she and Alice had bought together some weeks ago, already tight enough to give her a distinct muffin-top along the circumference of her belly, were strewn across the ugly fake house plant that sat in the corner. Her bright blue top met a similar fate, wadded up on the floor not far from the couch. And there, laying on the couch, was what was left of Cass Morgan.

Trading in her pants for a pair of leggings, the outline of her belly clear as day as it bulged underneath her loose KISS 102.5 t-shirt, Cass looked like an absolute wreck. Dark circles of ruined makeup ran down her cheeks, streaking gray flooding from her eyes as she bawled helplessly on her seat. Cass had done what she could to tell Alice the details of her termination in the text messages, but during her spectacular breakdown on the other end of the line, she managed to forgo just how torn up she really was.

"Fired!" Cass bellowed, spoon filled with strawberry ice cream that quickly made its way to her quivering mouth, "I can't believe it! I'm such a loser!"

Alice's hands pat Cass on the soft back as she collapsed into her friend's pillowy bosom. She hugged Alice's ample frame tightly, shuddering as she bawled openly in the arms of what now felt like her only friend.

"Honey, you're not a loser." Alice stroked Cass lovingly, comfortingly, with one hand, "This could happen to anyone."

"Except Marni." Cass spat distastefully, "How the fuck does that short little cunt get to keep her job?"

"Cassie, sweetie—"

"She didn't even stick up for me!" the former fitness queen bellowed, straightening up so she could get some more ice cream from the carton, "She just... just stood there and watched while I got my ass handed to me!"

Cass had been alternating between emotional tirades and emphatic tantrums since before Alice arrived. She had never thought that she—one of the first names in local radio hostessing—would be handed her entire career like this. And for such shoddy reasons! "Marketing issues", "budget cuts", who the hell cared? She didn't deserve this! She didn't...

Cass collapsed back into Alice. Of course she deserved this. She'd been pigging out on corporate sponsorship for a long time now. Getting fat off of profit, phoning it in on-air and leaving Marni to do all the hard work. Their ratings had dropped just as quickly as her weight started to rise, and now she was in the only logical position there was left: a washed-out, blown-up hasbeen crying on her couch. A couch she couldn't really afford anymore, at that...

"So..." Alice ventured tentatively, "What are you gonna do?"

"I don't know." Cass sniffed, putting the nearly emptied carton down, "My career is wrecked. It'll be years until I get another job like the one I pissed away..."

An awkward silence filled the apartment as Cass began to cry again. Ever the people pleaser, Alice set straight into work.

"I-I could see if I could get you a job at Gordge!" she offered helpfully and enthusiastically, "We're looking for someone to fill in for a transfer!"

"Jesus christ, I don't know Al..."

"Just until you get another job on the radio." Alice did her best to smile reassuringly, "We all loved to listen to you on the radio, so I doubt anyone would say no to having a local celebrity come work with us."

"Oh jeez, don't—"

"Come on!" Alice smacked her friend on the arm playfully, "I can talk to Jenna tomorrow and maybe you can have a job by the end of the week. What do you say?"
15212312.title: Fallen Starlet

choices: Jenna's right—Cass integrates herself with the Gordge staff
Jenna's right—Cass goes home to depression eat that whole cake
Jenna's right—but you have a free choice as to how exactly
152123121.content:
And that’s how Cass Morgan—former radio hostess—came to work for Gordge.

Alice had spent the last few days hanging out at her apartment. She’d been there for all the ups and the downs, watching her friend’s mood ping-pong from resigned to hopeful to optimistic to crashing and burnt. She was there when Cass realized that she didn’t have any business casual wear that fit her in the closet, she was there when she drunk-messaged Marni and made an ass out of herself, and she was there for the feel-better ice cream binges and the clothes shopping. And more importantly, Alice was going to be there for her at her first day at work!

Cass wobbled through the office doors like a kid on her first day of school—her eyes simultaneously wide and darting everywhere but to the people around her, feet shuffling, tugging at her uncomfortable new clothes. It had been so long since she’d had to wear a blouse to work that she’d honestly forgotten how to wear one. How did she look? What would all of her coworkers think? Would they know how pathetic she felt, coming into an office job after years of working in a radio show? What she wouldn’t have done for just another day to stay in bed and mope…

“Come on, Cass—I’ll take you to meet the girls.”

“But I already know the girls.” The chunky brunette said dryly

“Noooo, the old Cass Morgan knew the girls!” Alice said chipperly, taking her elbow and locking it in the smothering nook between her fleshy forearm and her upper armwing, “They have yet to meet the new and improved Cass Morgan!”

The new and improved Cass Morgan. What a joke. Eighty pounds heavier and crammed into a blouse. Working at a dumb office job to pay the bills until she could get another job back on the radio. As grateful as she was to Alice for helping her score this job at Gordge, she could have dialed it back a little bit.

Alice led Cass down the aisle of cubicles, waving at familiar faces and showing off their new coworker. Cass sheepishly ducked away from the limelight as well as she could. She wasn’t exactly in the best place to take affection right now. Never the less, Alice wasn’t going to let up anytime soon—the big sweet balloon was showing her off like she’d discovered a new species or something.

“This is our new girl Cass Morgan!” Alice would gesture with prestige, “From the KISS morning show?”

Admittedly, getting to see everyone’s wowed (or if not wowed, at least polite) expressions did Cass some good. It was nice to know that people enjoyed her work on the show, and she’d be coming into a place where people already seemed to know her well enough. Or at least, her radio personality.

How much of her radio personality was different from her regular personality—she hadn’t even thought about that…

Eventually the parade led to a large room a little off of the beaten path. The building was divided into two main halves, and in the middle was a hallway. At the end of that hallway was a small black and white plaque that said BREAK ROOM.

“Jeez Alice, we just got here.” Cass snarked, “I know it’s my first day, but I don’t think I need a break just yet.”

“Sure you do!” Alice smiled, her chubby cheeks bunching as she nudged her friend by the chubby buns into the room, “Go on in!”

Taking the handle in hand, Cass shrugged and opened the door. Feeling around for the light switch, Cass touched the side of the wall and flipped a large switch. The fluorescent lighting came to life, and with it so did the break room—

“SURPRISE!”

Cass was assaulted with the sight of about ten women waiting for her, all spread out along the break room. Some of them, she knew already—Alice’s friends Melissa and Courtney were faces she recognized. But then there were younger ladies, like a blonde with glasses and a sort of Italian looking woman whose enthusiasm didn’t quite match the rest of them. But in the middle was the largest woman that Cass had ever seen—Jenna, her new boss.

“Welcome aboard Cass Morgan!” she said with a smile, holding a sheet cake in both of her chubby hands, “What do you think—were you surprised?”

“I…” Cass blinked, her eyes getting watery, “You don’t do this for all the new hires, do you?”

“Well, we haven’t been listening to most new hires on the radio for years and years!” Alice grabbed her friend by the shoulder and forced her into her fluffy side, “We already feel like you’re part of the family!”

“You… you do?” Cass asked dumbly, starstruck, “You guys…”

“This is about the only special treatment you’re gonna get, so don’t get too used to it.” Melissa snorted, “If we bought a cake for every new hire, I’d be Courtney’s size by now.”

“Hey!”

Jenna waddled over handing Cass the sheet cake. There were three little candles on top, and in pink frosting, the words WELCOME CASS had been written. Struggling to maintain her composure, Cass took a big breath and blew out the three of them as her new cast of coworkers cheered.

“Okay, I’ll give everyone thirty minutes and then back to work.” Jenna said as the applause died down, “Cass, hun, welcome to Gordge—I think you've got a big future ahead of you."
152123121.title: Cass the Gordge Girl

choices: Cass goes to lunch with Alice, Melissa & Courtney—Bad influences, all around!
Cass goes to lunch with Alice, Vicky & Christina—the newbies show her the ropes!
Cass goes to lunch with Alice and the whole office—God, these women can eat!
1521231211.content:
It had been an awfully long time since Cass Morgan had been able to go anywhere and not be… well, Cass Morgan. Her radio program may not have reached the largest population, over the years it had afforded her a certain level of local fame that had made it at least a little difficult for her to go out and just try to be a normal human being. Her face being one half of two on a billboard certainly hadn’t helped matters in that regard—but now that it had officially been painted over, that sort of acted as the definitive nail in her radiowave career, at least for now.

She’d be hard-pressed to admit it, but there was a certain appeal to her new life as just regular old Cass Morgan—one of many code monkeys, agents, and otherwise chair squashers at Gordge.

“Hey Cassie!” came the voice of her truest and oldest friend at Gordge, Alice Gellar, as she toddled towards her cubicle, “I made a run by the snack machine—brought you your favorites~”

As soon as Cass took her eyes off of the screen she’d been staring at for the better half of her morning, she was greeted with a package of powdered white donuts. She managed to catch them, with some struggle, as Alice finished her wobbling walk up to Cass’s desk. Her own matching package in hand, her stubby but nimble fingers were already working the clear plastic wrapping open.

“Thanks Al—but I really don’t think I should.” The brunette lowered the donuts onto the desk, her grip loosening slightly, “I just got this suit like two weeks ago and it’s already a little tight. I’m gonna have to start cutting back.”

“Oh come on, we’re celebrating!” the three-hundred-plus pound woman was as giddy as a schoolgirl, already a donut deep into her five-snack pack, “It’s your first week—you’re gonna be bombarded with snacks around here, so you might as well enjoy it while they’re free.”

Cass grimaced a bit as she watched the outcome of that philosophy stand in front of her, rolling over the waistband of her circus tent skirt. Alice was a big girl, and it had never really been an issue before. Even back when Cass was much more into fitness and all that junk (a habit that she often chided herself about getting back into!), she’d never given much thought about where all of Alice’s extra fluff came from. But after less than a week of working at Gordge… it was pretty clear that her workspace had something to do with it!

But on the other hand, they were free. And if she said no, what was Alice going to do? Shoot them back up into the vending machine? She might as well enjoy herself a little…

They were celebrating.

“What the hell.” Cass finally said with a shrug of her soft shoulders as she ripped into the packaging, “It’s not every day you get a new job, right?”

“That’s right!” Alice giggled, “Ooh, that reminds me, some of the girls wanted to take you out to lunch—do you wanna go?”

“I mean, yeah, sounds great.” Cass bit into half of a powdered white donut, “I could afford to not pay for lunch.”

“Okay cool, I’ll let them know.” The big blonde smiled excitedly as she began to walk away, her lips dusted with confectionary powder, before turning back, “I know I’ve told you this a lot, but… it’s so great having you work here—I mean, best friend talk, I know we don’t like to talk about the past, but we’ve listened to your show for years.”

Cass felt that bittersweet pang of former radio starlet status tickle the back of her throat. It wasn’t exactly easy thinking of what had been—and what she’d thought she’d always be—as of just a few weeks ago. She hadn’t even turned on the radio in her car coming to work, and hadn’t for the past few days. That being said, when Alice and the other girls talked to her about it… it didn’t always feel bad. Especially when she said things like—

“You’re basically one of us already.”

And as her best friend walked away, clicking and clacking on her overtaxed heels, Cass felt pretty good about her choice to come to Gordge. It had been hard at first, but only a week in and everyone had done such a good job of making her feel welcome. Maybe it would be a little much smushing lunch on top of what had turned into a big breakfast and a donut or two from the employee lounge (and now these little guys) but they had been putting in a lot of effort to keep her happy around here, and in just her first few days.

Her diet could start next week—after all, she had a lot to celebrate.
1521231211.title: Getting into the Gordge Groove

choices: Cass maintains some semblance of dieting, at the cost of integrating a bit
Cass's attempts to diet fall flat—it isn't long before she starts to expand
Why the fuck even diet, right? New Cass is Fun Cass!
15212312111.content:
“Cass!”

Courtney and Melissa were two of Alice’s friends who Cass had met once or twice before coming to work at the offices. They were big girls, like Alice. Rather, they were bigger girls than Alice, and built very differently. Melissa was all belly, and Courtney had the biggest set of T&A that Cass had ever seen on anyone in person. Alice was somewhere in between, just kind of big all over, like a marshmallow.

This wasn’t very important, except for the fact that it made it very difficult for them all to sit at the same table.

They had all agreed to eat out at some Mexican restaurant called Juan Gringo’s. Apparently Friday was Extra-Long Lunch Day, which meant that they could afford to have a margarita or two at lunch (given the size of them, maybe even three) without being too tipsy to get back to work. It was something of a tradition for the three of them, give or take a guest, to frequent the Tex-Mex restaurant on these weekly occasions so that they could really get their grub on.

Today, Cass was one of those guests.

“Woof, you are lookin’ hot.” Melissa said with gusto as she took a gulp from her half-drunken martini, “Is that a new suit?”

“Maybe.” Cass said in a playful, confident tone as she wriggled into the inside of the king-sized booth, “I’d like to think that I’ve got a face that people would like to see on a billboard.”

“I’ll say you do.” Courtney chuckled thickly, her fat neck rings jiggling, “The rest of us would just have to settle for being the billboard.”

There was a good laugh between all four of them—their fat bellies wobbling in deprecation of their own stupendous sizes. Such a meeting of massive women could only come from the Gordge offices, and everyone at Juan Gringo’s could pick out the new hires as easy as uno-dos-tres. Granted, Cass had something of a head start over the likes of Christina and Victoria (not that they were exactly skinny anymore, these days) even if she did look sort of familiar.

Cass was sandwiched in as Alice wriggled her way into the booth, filling more than her fair share of the poor overtaxed seat as she spilled over and onto the table. Her belly met in conference with Melissa and Courtney’s—both larger, both greedier guts—as if they were privately discussing in gastrointestinal code what to make of Cass’s starter gut. The round radio siren couldn’t have looked more out of place with the three blimpy office fatties, though she would admit to coming around.

“What’s to eat?” Courtney finally said as she opened the menu, “The usual?”

“The usual.” Melissa nodded definitively, barely bothering with the menu and far more focused on wrapping her chubby finger around the martini glass, “Maybe a little something extra though. Are you feeling dessert?”

“I could do dessert.” Alice added without hesitation, “Cassie, you want some dessert?”

“No, I shouldn’t.” Cass pat her round tummy beneath her blouse, “M’on a diet.”

Cass’s news of diet and moderation was met with the usual fervor that one would expect from a bunch of overfed office fatties. Being the smallest member of the group, none of the three massive ladies saw any reason for Cass Morgan—former radio star and barely at two hundred pounds to their three-plus—to do something as silly as diet.

“Ugh, why though?”

“Since when?”

“You, like, look so good though.”

And Cass took it all in stride—it was nice to be complimented after feeling like shit about herself for so long, after all.

“Thanks, but I’ve really let myself go lately.” She said with a derisive pat of her belly, “You might say it’s been a LONG time since my last Mimosa and Yoga special.”

And they all laughed—despite having literally no inclination to participate in what had once been Cass’s fitness-oriented special that happened every second Tuesday, they all caught the reference. It was a little strange for the three of them to put the name to the face. They had always—Alice included—Cass as this thin, athletic, toned woman who would never have sat down and had a meal with any of them. Marni had always been the favorite for her likability, after all. The woman sitting across from them wasn’t Cass Morgan, the Morning Show Starlet though. She was just… Cass—their new recruit.

And if nothing else, Gordge Girls knew how to welcome new recruits.

“Diets are dumb and tacos are great.” Courtney corrected her curvy coworker, “I’m very firmly in the camp of chalking this up to you trying to mingle with the cool kids.”

“Yeah, come on, it’s just one dinner.” Melissa snorted, fat chins bunching, “What’s the harm?”

And Cass was still a little on the fence about it. But it was when Alice, her longtime buddy and the person who had helped her get this job, leaned in and gave her a tight little side hug (smushing her against her ample amounts of side-boob) and a little shoulder pat that Cass really started to get on board with the idea of just a little extra indulgence.

“We’re celebrating, remember?” Alice offered in a helpful tone, “New job, new life… new Cass. Y’know?”

And there was that pause—there’s always the pause.

“What the hell.” Cass said for the second time that day, “You guys are paying, right?”

“Yeah.”

“Definitely, we got you girl.”

“Then bring on the tacos.” Cass took the margarita from the delivering waitress’s hand and tipped it behind her head, “And bring on the dessert!”

She was met with a chorus of cheers from the three fat women as she sat at attention in her seat at the booth. She wasn’t getting out any time soon, and they were already bringing in the girls’ lunch. A smorgasbord of meat and tortillas, cheese and sour crème, lettuce and tomato, with burritos and salsa, chips and queso…

A part of her was worried, sure, but…

She was celebrating.

New job, new life... new Cass, right?
15212312111.title: The New Cass

choices: Cass doesn't get too big, at least not yet—she needs help!
Cass is getting pretty chunky, and fast—she's a swelling starlet!
Cass gets pretty fucking big—she leans hard into the Gordge lifestyle
152123121112.content:
Let it be said here, if nowhere else, that Cass did at least attempt to maintain some semblance of control.

Unlike a lot of their formerly fit employees (cough cough, Alice, cough cough, Courtney) Cass was not as easily swayed to the lazy lifestyle that Gordge offered its employees. The benefits were great and she liked the other girls but Cass was, deep down inside, still a fit girl at heart. She wasn’t as inherently lazy as some of the other girls that had wandered (later waddled) through the doors, and wouldn’t so easily succumb to every tempting treat that crossed her path. Just because she wasn’t on the radio anymore didn’t mean that she was keen on blowing up into a balloon.

That being said, diets were fucking hard enough already without working at Gordge.

Everything was practically built around food in these stupid offices, from the morning meetings to the casual conversations between employees, to how you traded for favors. In her first week alone, Cass had wound up with more apple pies, coffee cakes, and donut packages than she thought she’d ever eat, and it was all so that Christina could have the third off on short notice—Cass was a little hard up for money, given her recent termination at the station, and she wasn’t exactly keen on saying no. But these snacks…

“Thank you so much, Ms. Morgan.” Christina folded her hands in front of her, “I really appreciate you doing this for me.”

*munch munch*

“I mean, it’s no problem.” Cass brushed the apple pie crust from her lips, “You didn’t have to bribe me after I already said yes.”

“I know, I just really wanted to show you how much I appreciate it.” She offered a genuine smile, “Alice said that you liked these so I figured, you know, you did me a favor…”

As if giving her all these snacks were a favor. All Cass seemed to do at her desk was eat—crunch numbers, type on her keyboard, and eat. At least at the station she could get up a little between commercial breaks. She’d barely left her office chair since this morning. Lunch was just around the corner, and Alice and the girls wanted to go out again, and she barely felt like she’d have any room…

But it was Fish Camp Tuesday—and Cass had learned to live for that shit.

“I appreciate it, but next time just slip me a twenty or something.” Cass laughed, her belly bobbing a bit underneath her blouse, “I don’t need all the extra calories.”

The skinny intern smiled approvingly, appreciatively, and dipped out back to running whatever errand that Courtney currently had her working on. They worked the hound out of that poor woman, but it made Cass all the more appreciative that she’d been hired on full-time right from the start.

All that gophering, going from place to place looked exhausting.

***


“So, like, this is what I use to get past the firewall.” Victoria said in a bored tone of voice as she shifted on her meaty ass in Cass’s chair, “It’s not the best program, but it’ll like let you get on Facebook and shit.”

Cass had never been very tech-y. Personally, she’d never expected Victoria to be very tech-y either, given her thousand-yard stare and inability to answer even a simple phone call. But that wide-rumped Italian woman had been very helpful in finding a way to make Cass’s workspace more accessible—it was a crime that she wasn’t given access to the entire internet at a place where she had to spend most of her time. Normally she’d use her phone but this place had shitty signal and the wi-fi was subject to the same rules as the terminals.

Thus, Victoria’s big round ass squished into her office chair.

“Thank you so much, Vicky.” Cass said, standing awkwardly in a place that she’d gotten very accustomed to sitting in, “I really appreciate this.”

“Whatever—I did you a favor, right?” Vicky swiveled, her round belly pouring onto her lap as she turned to face Cass with a bored expression on her face, “Do you think you could, like, put in a good word with Jenna and get her to spring for some extra donuts around here?”

“I mean… there are already a lot of donuts.”

“We always run out because Melissa and Courtney are fucking pigs—and I know that’s not HR friendly or whatever, but I’m pretty triggered.” Vicky said with a dangerous, venomous roll of her brown bovine eyes, “Jenna’s, like, in love with you because you were on some dumb radio show or whatever? She’ll take whatever you say pretty seriously.”

And a part of Cass—the part of her that still wasn’t over not being a local celebrity anymore—felt a little touched by the insinuation (accusation?) that because of her status, Cass could convince anyone to do anything. Let alone her boss. Even if she’d eaten enough donuts in the past few days to fill a bakery, the thought alone was… well, it was something that she wasn’t sure that she’d ever feel again as far as her own lingering fame was concerned.

“I think I can manage that.” Cass said confidently, her arms crossed over her full chest as the fabric in the back of her blazer stretched taut, “I’ll put a good word in for you.”

“Whatever.” Victoria rolled her eyes and, awkwardly, tossed an apple pie on the desk, “This is for you. Just, like… thanks. Or something.”

***


Of all the stupid plugs that she’d had to do in her years of radio, she’d never once been to Dumpo’s.

It was this horrible, hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop that only someone as brash and (frankly) kind of trashy as Melissa would frequent. And normally she wouldn’t have been caught dead in a place like this (especially during her Yoga guru days) but Cass hadn’t regretted her decision since she’d first bit into her hoagie.

GOD this was a good sandwich.

“Yeah, I’ll get you fat.” Melissa chuckled thickly, encompassing literally the entirety of the other side of the booth, “I know all the best places—Dumpo’s, Italiano’s, the pizza place up on main. Jesus Christ Cass, you don’t even fucking know.”

The meat was so greasy. It practically dripped off of her chin. And the thought of something like that was, inherently, disgusting. That pale yellow shit rolling down from her chin—the Old Cass would have never been caught dead in a place like this.

But she was beginning to see the appeal.

“Okay, so, I’m on a diet—” Cass said as a more of a formality than a disclaimer, “—but I think once a week, maybe twice… that wouldn’t be so bad.”

“Pssh.” Melissa snorted, her flat nostrils curling at the idea of moderation, “Suit yourself, Radio Star, but I probably park my fat ass here at least every other day.”

Melissa’s great gut gurgled in agreement of the larger opinion. If it was possible, she looked to have grown even larger since Cass had started. No one in the Gordge Offices was exactly Jenny Craig-ing, but Melissa was the most adamant about her eating habits. If anything, the woman was on an anti-diet—a regiment that Cass found awfully hard to pass up on the occasions that Melissa invited her out for lunch, or dinner after work.

“I can see why.” Cass practically moaned as she took another big bite, “This is great.”

“You know, I used to think that Marni was the fun one on KISS 102.5.” Mel smacked her greasy lips, “But I’ve gotta say, I’m comin’ around to the new Cass.”

And, as silly as it might have sounded, Cass could only shrink into her shoulders and smile. It was so nice to hear that she was beginning to grow on people. Even if she was growing a little outwards in the process. Her skirt was getting tighter by the day, and this morning she’d popped a button on her blouse…

“You wanna grab some ice cream?” Melissa asked after a truly heroic bite of sandwich, “I know a great place downtown.”

“I mean…” Cass grimaced, stifling a greasy burp that squeaked out of her packed-tight stomach, “I don’t see why not.”

***


Again, let it be said (if nowhere else but here) that Cass made an attempt at dieting. But it was hard. Harder than she was prepared for it to be—without the funds provided by her cushy radio job, she was suddenly out of a gym membership, out of the means to afford her pricy fitness foods, and saddled with a whole community of women who seemed to equate friendship with food. Already having securely fallen off of the fitness wagon, Cass could only do her best not to see the writing on the walls.

Snacks, plus friends, plus big meals, minus exercise, plus even more to eat throughout the day…

Well, the important part was that she was having fun, right?
152123121112.title: Resistance is Futile

choices: Cass loses enthusiasm for the whole diet and exercise thing, but Alice doesn't!
Alice falls off the Diet and Exercise wagon for good, but Cass is still going!
They both fall off the wagon, and both their waistlines suffer for it!
1521232.content:
As the bloated beauties waddled out of the buffet, and Marni waved a goodbye, with a loud yell "See ya at the singles bar saturday!" Cass replied, "You too!" With the gluttonous glob that was Marni gone, Cass turned to Alice. "Alice, I just wanna say, I'm proud that you're eating better." Alice nodded. "Well, you know, I kinda got tired of being this big." Cass spoke. "Y'know, I miss my old routine and I was wondering, wanna hit up the gym with me?" Alice replied, "Hells yeah! Let's go, I was actually planning to go."

As the obese blonde squeezed her way into Cass' passenger seat, Cass slid into the driver's seat. As alice struggled with the seatbelt, having to stretch hit out to about as far as it would go to be able to barely force it into the buckle, Cass noticed her paunch as she slid the keys into the ignition and pulled it. Though she was not nearly as fat as Marni, let alone Alice, she was considerably larger. She had grown a paunch that added about 6 inches to her formerly waifish 25 inches, giving her a rather large 31 inch waist. Her bust had booned from this, however, also growing to 39 inches from her old 36. Her booty had gained the least out of them, at a 2 inch growth from 35 to 37. With the ignition lit and the two fat females prepared, Cass pulled out of the park, and drove to Jim's Gym.

Jim's was a rather squat 2 story building, built wide to fit every inch of the lot space. The windows were wide and spacious, but tinted to block vision inside. Alice popped open the buckle, the seatbelt reeling back and seemingly sighing in relief, and Cass unlocked the doors, popped out, and grabbed her Gym bag, as did Alice. The plus-sized ladies approached the receptionist, who was a bright blonde, whom they could tell had dyed her hair, who was a little larger around the middle than they expected, just a little short from Cass' size. "Hey! Can I help you two?" "Yeah," said Cass, "We'd like to buy a membership." The receptionist, whose name was given away from her tag as being 'Samantha', replied. "Alright! How many months?" Cass, emboldened by her recent earnings, said "5 months, I'll cover both." After a swipe of a debit card, and a bit of shuffling behind the counter, the chubby blonde handed them a dark-blue card, with the red words 'JIM'S GYM' and a lighter blue phoenix in the background. "All right! You're good to go!" spoke the chubby blonde, who promptly sat back down, and after checking for anyone else, returned to dutiously scarfing down a Snicker's before the Management could see.

The two blubbery maidens waddled over to the Cardio machines, where awaited an assortment of machines: Stationary cycles, both of a normal type and a flywheel type (The kind used in Spin classes,) as well as Stairsteppers, Treadmills, Ellipticals, stretching machines, and, surrounding it all, a track. Across the track lay the weightlifter's realm, with a variety of free-weight machines: Arms, Legs, Bench, Squat racks, and an area with a horridly cracked floor and a free-weight rack that stretched up for what seemed like miles. Any experienced lifter would know that as the Deadlift area. On the upper floors there was, at first, a lounge filled with healthy vending machines, and beyond that, fitness classrooms, for everything from Yoga, to Zumba, to Spin, to Jazz and Tap dancing.

To start off their routine, Alice and Cass began on the Treadmills. Not eager to do any running after the massive splurge both ladies had just eaten, they simply walked at 3 mph at a steep incline. Doing a solid 30 minutes, they took a break afterwards and watched the Television at the Juice Bar, where they drank from their capacious water bottles. Beside them were a row of buff bodybuilders, all talking about their latest lifts and their troubles in life. There was a fourth man, not partaking in the conversation. At first, to Cass, it seemed like hew as simply staring off into space. Then, she realized that the angle of his eyes was more or less pointed at her and Alice. Cass, without directly looking at the guy, nudged Alice, whispering to her. "Watch this." She then turned her head slowly and at a deliberate pace towards the man, paused for a moment until the buff black-haired man's eyes fixed on her. Then, she pulled the Coup de Grace: A deadly, well placed wink in his direction, before she retracted her head. Alice couldn't help but look on in awe at this master of seduction, as the black-haired man's jaw practically hung open. "Damn, you gotta teach me how to do that."

After the bout of flirting and rehydration at the Bar, the two ladies, still a little winded from the walking, shifted to the Elliptical machines. Alice was not as confident in her abilities, so she kept the resistance low. However, Cass, after managing to survive 30 minutes steep walking on a treadmill, was rather more cocky, as she cranked resistance up to 15. She rapidly regretted her decision after about a minute, and withdrew her cockiness. Alice giggled a bit through her panting. The two managed to go for about 15 minutes more, until they decided to try the daunting Stairmasters. After a bit of rehydration, they daringly assaulted the Stairmasters.

The stairmasters hit back: After only 5 minutes, the two were forced to withdraw. Feeling sore but satisfied, the two ladies passed the receptionist Samantha, who now scarfed down a bag of chips away from the gaze of her Supervisor. After this initial bout of exercise, one of the ladies decided they couldn't handle it...
1521232.title: Cass back on the wagon

info.description:
Welcome to 'Office Fatty',
There aren't too many rules for adding to this story except
- Only Female weight gain
- No ridiculous gains of like 40 pounds in one meal
- No magic based weight gain, from like a magic potion or something
- Don't add a chapter thats only like 3 or 4 sentences

that's it! Hope you enjoy and hope you add your own chapters and make the story grow!
